meanings.definition: Relating to the physiology of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neurophysiological research focused on how the brain sends signals.
meanings.sent2: The doctor conducted a neurophysiological examination to understand the patient's nerve functions.
meanings.sent3: The neurophysiological puzzle was so tricky that even the neurons were confused!
meanings.sent4: Her neurophysiological approach to problem-solving was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The neurophysiological intricacies of the nervous system were as fascinating as a complex maze.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of the functions of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neurophysiological textbook explained the different nerve functions in detail.
meanings.sent2: Researchers conducted a neurophysiological study to understand how the brain processes information.
meanings.sent3: The neurophysiological experiment was so engaging that even the neurons were excited!
meanings.sent4: His neurophysiological investigation into the brain's functions was like unraveling a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The neurophysiological exploration of nerve functions was as enlightening as a journey through the mind.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the physical and chemical processes of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neurophysiological changes in the brain were evident after the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the neurophysiological aspects of neurotransmitter release.
meanings.sent3: The neurophysiological reaction was so quick that even the neurons were surprised!
meanings.sent4: The neurophysiological processes in the brain were like a symphony of chemical reactions.
meanings.sent5: The neurophysiological understanding of nerve processes was as clear as a sunny day.
